alert.note: Alert for Otsego; Sullivan (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 07 at 11:29PM EDT until April 09 at 3:01AM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 AM EDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central New York, including the following counties, Delaware, Otsego and Sullivan. * WHEN...Until 530 AM EDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1129 PM EDT, Widespread moderate rainfall continues to move across the area. While the rain will abate in the next 2 or 3 hours, rainfall amounts have reached a threshold where minor flooding problems are beginning to arise. Between 1.50 and 2.50 inches of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Oneonta, Monticello, Liberty, Walton, Delhi, Cooperstown, Fallsburg, Bethel, Neversink, South Fallsburg, Davenport, Roxbury, Worcester, Middlefield, Hartwick, Colchester, Maryland, Edmeston, Meredith and Pittsfield. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
